summary: James N. Roethe was a staff member involved in taking depositions and gathering information related to potential CIA involvement in assassination plots and other sensitive activities. He participated in the deposition of Frank Sturgis and Wilfredo Navarro on April 4, 1975, and Frank Sturgis on April 3, 1975. Roethe also summarized information obtained from George Brewer regarding the CIA's Washington Field Office activities in a memorandum dated February 24, 1975. His work appears to be focused on investigating potential CIA connections to various controversial operations and individuals during the period covered by the Rockefeller Commission.
significance: James N. Roethe's significance lies in his role as a staff member involved in gathering testimony and information related to potential CIA involvement in assassination plots and other sensitive activities. His work contributed to the investigation of these matters during the period covered by the Rockefeller Commission.
